00108 inline std::basic_ostream<ff_char_t>& fmt_slices(
00109     std::basic_ostream<ff_char_t>&  sink
00110 ,   int                             flags
00111 ,   size_t                          cchTotal
00112 ,   size_t                          numResults
00113 ,   ff_string_slice_t const*        results
00114 )
00115 {
00116     stlsoft::auto_buffer<ff_char_t> buff(cchTotal + 1);
00117 
00118 #ifndef STLSOFT_CF_THROW_BAD_ALLOC
00119     if(!buff.empty())   // May return false when exception-handling not enabled
00120 #endif /* !STLSOFT_CF_THROW_BAD_ALLOC */
00121     {
00122 #if !defined(FASTFORMAT_NO_NAMESPACE)
00123         using ::fastformat::util::concat_slices;
00124 #endif /* !FASTFORMAT_NO_NAMESPACE */
00125 
00126         concat_slices(buff, numResults, results);
00127 
00128         if(flags::ff_newLine & flags)
00129         {
00130             buff[cchTotal] = '\n';
00131         }
00132         else
00133         {
00134             buff.resize(buff.size() - 1);
00135         }
00136 
00137 #if defined(STLSOFT_COMPILER_IS_MSVC) && \
00138     _MSC_VER == 1400
00139         // VC++ 8 erroneously (at least IMO) asserts on the validity of the
00140         // pointer given to write() even when count is 0. Other versions
00141         // (including 9) don't do this, so we won't bother to catch it
00142         // otherwise.
00143         if(0 != buff.size())
00144 #endif /* compiler */
00145         {
00146             sink.write(buff.data(), static_cast<std::streamsize>(buff.size()));
00147         }
00148 
00149         if(flags::ff_flush & flags)
00150         {
00151             sink.flush();
00152         }
00153     }
00154 
00155     if(sink.fail())
00156     {
00157 #ifdef STLSOFT_CF_EXCEPTION_SUPPORT
00158         // TODO: Use more-derived exception and capture errno
00159         throw sink_output_exception("Failed to write/flush statement");
00160 #endif /* STLSOFT_CF_EXCEPTION_SUPPORT */
00161     }
00162 
00163     return sink;
00164 }
